website_summaries.verdict: Setup is a pain, but you really can't argue with the price -- it provides incredible value that can't be beat by any other signal booster currently on the market.
pros: significant power boost (especially for the money)
plenty of mounting options means versatility
cons: Best used with outside antenna and it is critical to point antenna toward a cell tower

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all 🙄
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this product. I’ve been using this product for 4 months now and still drop calls daily. I’ve called my cell phone carrier multiple times along with weboost. The weboost rep was very snarky on the phone when I asked him if I set it up right. I did set it up right, but still can’t get phone calls to stick. When you’re running a business, this is the worst thing that can happen. I am sad that I’m out of the window of returning this product. I just kept giving it the benefit of the doubt. Poor service. Poor costumes service.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is poor, which is a bummer considering how expensive this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just OK. Gets us a usable signal, but properly positioning the indoor and outdoor antennas can be a pain (they need to be separated by a large distance which means routing a coax cable clear across your house). Build quality is poor, which is a bummer considering how expensive this is. The coax cable inside our antenna broke off. The cable is not properly strain relieved and is attached inside only by solder.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousRobotBuilders

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Did nothing at all to help my cell reception. I have a strong signal on the roof where the antenna was mounted, all green lights on the amplifier, but absolutely no change in strength or quality of the signal inside the house. Followed installation instructions to a tee and tried 3 different mounting locations and countless adjustments to the antenna alignment to no avail. Tried calling tech support on a Sunday only to learn they don't have 24/7 support. Very disappointing - sending back.
customer_reviews.author: CDKellers

customer_reviews.title: 4 to 5 bars inside my steel building
customer_reviews.text: In service for more than a year. Started with a bar and a half, 4G was iffy. This is a great booster. I used the flat panel antenna inside and added a domed yagi outside. So I added $50 to the cost to eliminate the desk antenna. Aiming was done with a YX699 direct connect (not cheap) meter. Signal is huge. 5 bars for about 500 sq ft but the signal is useable for the whole 1800 sq ft steel building. Phone and text great. Data is impressive for my hot spot. Reliable talk, text and internet on the cheap. Price and performance in line with the "install and forget" convenience.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This product is bad reviews say spend time with out side antenna.I spent 3 days moving to 4 different locations,each time I got 4 green lights on booster and could never get more than 1 bar of verizon service which was what I had before spending 400 dollars followed all instructions and reinstalled every way suggested and nothing, neighbor has a cheaper competitive brand and we are pointed at the same tower I am going to see what kind they have they are getting 4 bars at all times. Needless to say I am very unhappy and want to send this junk back. Will update with name od device that does work. Also installation instructions and troubleshooting instructions are terrible,
customer_reviews.author: TIM k.

customer_reviews.title: Amazed that it actually worked
customer_reviews.text: I was getting no signal in my house. I bought this on a flyer thinking it was probably a scam. I have a second and third floor deck. I downloaded "phone signal" ap and walked around on both of my decks for best signal. I found the best signal which was about 1 bar on my third floor deck. I mounted the antenna to a 15 foot pole and installed it there. I installed the booster and indoor antenna on my first floor. I powered up the unit and got 4 bars (90dB), I unplugged the unit and got "no service (-120dbB)" plugged it back in and was back to 4 bars. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Boundary

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions to the letter.
customer_reviews.text: I hate 2 bars without the product. Put on a metal roof and could not get a signal at all or 4g. After installation I now have a solid 3 bars throughout the house. One story ranch style home. I did run some extra cable cause I ran it to a location I wanted it. Just make sure you read the instruction cause the unit does have to be a certain distance from the antenna. I was worried about adding 10 more foot of cable to the antenna but it seemed to work fine. They do recommend using some apps to find your nearest tower and that helps to use the apps for pointing your outside antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Referbished is risky, but works great for Verizon
customer_reviews.text: Went from 0-1 bars in my bedroom to 4 bars (I put the outdoor antenna on a long poll outside). This worked perfect for me. I live in a hollow surounded by trees and get little to no cell service but WeBoost boosted that weak signal! Yes, this product works for Verizon Jetpack (hotspot). Went from getting 1-3 mbs to about 14-20 mbs! Sooo worth the money. Note: I got this used on Amazon and they sent it to me with the wrong power supply cord. I contacted WeBoost support via email on there website and they got me a new power supply cord and booster for free withen a week. 10/10 costumer service on WeBoosts part.
customer_reviews.author: Xan Acktor

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the in-laws who live in an area where their Verizon service is terrible. They would get one bar if lucky. Half the time phone calls would cut in and out and text messages took forever to arrive. Didn't have much faith, but to my surprise, after installing this and putting the antenna on the roof, they now have mostly perfect reception and even data fast enough to watch videos via hot spot. Wish I knew about this in my old house where reception was also terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Michi

customer_reviews.title: Beyond impressed
customer_reviews.text: Well, to say that I'm impressed would be an understatement. Taken weak, slow Verizon LTE signal and boosted upload and download significant! In the photo, the top 3 tests were after, below that is before... Averaging over 7 Mbps after where before wouldn't reliably connect at all...
customer_reviews.author: Myqey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Installed the boosters as per the easy to understand instructions. It took about 30 minutes including the antenna mount. Installed the antenna 30’ above ground. Signal went from a weak 1 bar inside to a strong 4 bars. All the components look of good quality I was surprised at the back of the antenna not having a cover. I’m hoping all of the inside components are waterproof. Works as advertised! I will update later on it’s extebded durability.
customer_reviews.author: Cardman

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for about 6 months with our AT&T service then gradually declined and has gotten to the point of not working at all. The picture attached is my cell signal sitting approximately 15 feet from the small antenna. For the price, this thing is garbage. Update: failed to upload a 338kb screenshot showing only a single bar of service
customer_reviews.author: Dlane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions and Install it Correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Follow the instructions. I wanted to see if it worked and stuck it in a random window. Didn't work at all. Was about to send it back. Took it to the office and installed it on a pole pointing at my closest tower, did what the instructions said. Went from -115db (1 bar) and couldn't keep a call going to -85db and for weeks, no dropped calls at all. Worth every penny. Please, read the instructions, install it correctly and it will be the best investment you make if you like your phone to work in low signal areas!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Huntly

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older booster from weBoost that used the same indoor and outdoor antenna. It was about 3 years old and failed on me. I bought this one and was able to swap out the booster and indoor antenna and it worked perfectly. It has better coverage than the previous one too. I still haven't swapped the outdoor antenna. I have a signal in the majority of my home. Roughly 1700 sqft, single story. On the old one I had to be in the same room. Very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: for the first time in an year and half I can get mobile service at my home. It took a bit of words and a couple calls to the manufacture, but I finally got it installed. My only complaint is that the instructions were limited and not very clear. Once I got it installed it I now have 3G and some times 4G service and 3 to 4 bars most of the time. If you are having trouble getting a signal that is not constant or strong, you might give this a try
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Really helped my phone reception in my home.
customer_reviews.text: For the first four years that I've lived in this home, the cell service was spotty and then became non-existent. I purchased this item after an AT&T person suggested it. The closest tower is 1 1/4 miles away. I had ZERO bars in my bedroom. (iPhone XR) After this was installed, I now have 1-2 bars throughout my house. It is not great, but so much better than what it had been. The kit came with everything needed to install. My brother-in-law said it was easy to install. I believe him.
customer_reviews.author: Theaterdreamer

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a cabin by the lake. It has a metal roof and is located in country far from a cell tower. In good weather, I might get 1 to 2 bar signal and frequently lost my signal. Since I installed the WeBoost, I keep a 2 to 3 signal, no dropped calls and my internet speed has improved. It’s easy to install. It too under an hour for me and I’m in poor health. Wish I had installed it while we were living in the RV and having the cabin fixed up.
customer_reviews.author: J. OrrTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!  Changed a basement into a LTE basement!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put at parents house. Now everyone in the basement enjoys LTE speeds!!! Easy to install if you can work a simple drill. my service in the basement when from 1x speeds (hardly send text) to watching you tube. Parents don’t use internet so much, so the cancelled their internet and now they hotspot when they want to use their computer. Everyone’s experience of speed increase will differ. I watched a lot of YouTube videos on how to install and tips. I suggest you do the same. Definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: man50

customer_reviews.title: WOnderful product!!
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how well this works. We live in the middle of nowhere and I have never really gotten service inside my house. I always have had to go outside to talk on the phone. After installing this product I can now talk on the phone inside my house. Not only that the boost to our wifi is wonderful as well.
customer_reviews.author: T R

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I've installed. The first was for my mom in a metal building. I have verizon and I am 2 miles from the highway (out in the country). Outside I am getting about 6mbps on download because of the hills and trees. If I drive up to the highway, I get about 55mbps. In my house it's about 4mbps. I installed this antenna and booster and now I'm getting 35-45mbps in the house download and 12mbps upload. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good device but see notes on installation
customer_reviews.text: This booster is definitely helpful given my remote location. If you buy this, be prepared to spend some time experimenting wth the antenna location. Try to do a temporary mount and test different locations around the house. We found that we had poor results trying to mount the antenna on the inside of a window. But it worked well mounted on the outside. The other thing is that you need to make sure the antenna is mounted around 20 feet or more away from the base amplifier unit. The indoor antenna is very directional so you need to position that appropriately as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lang

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little over a year and the quality of the signal has faded. It has a two year warranty and after a year it has began to decline in signal boosting strength. This is the second one I have purchased and I am not happy. This product only seems to last a year and then you are out $400.00 every year. What happened to something that last?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We researched cell phone boosters and ended up getting the weBoost Home 4G booster and were very disappointed. I understand you
customer_reviews.text: We are staying in an RV park in an area that barely has any Verizon cell service. We researched cell phone boosters and ended up getting the weBoost Home 4G booster and were very disappointed. I understand you have to have some service to boost service and we did have some but the booster did not boost it unless we sat right next (within 6 inches) to the antenna to talk on the phone. Even then the call might drop if we turned our head. The only way we could get ahold of the support team was by email which took 12 to 24 hours for a reply. We ended up sending it back and getting a temporary land line.
customer_reviews.author: Beckie J.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product performance!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product refurbished by the manufacturer. I bought this for our home office where my Sprint service has only 1-2 bars of signal strength. Sometimes the WeBoost works, other times not. If my office mate gets on her AT&T phone, it will not carry my signal at the same time. Often it has trouble picking up and boosting my Sprint signal immediately after one of hervAT&T calls. When nobody else is in the office the signal amplification is hot or miss. Sometimes it works sometimes not. All in all, I am very frustrated with the purchase of this product. $400 spent with no reliable benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Grady Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 to 3 bars outside of house. Installed booster per instructions and aligned with strongest signal. Dont see much if any improvement unless you have your phone within 1 or 2 feet od the inside antenna. Def not worth the money. Update..called weboost re the problem of this booster not working and was told to just buy more powerful booster and inside antenna. Really? Why would i want to spend more money on questionable equipment. This booster is nothing mpre than snake oil.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Installation was quick and the results amazing from 1-2 bars signal to constant 3-4 inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with an AT&T Microcell for days, finally purchased this unit. Installation was quick and the results amazing from 1-2 bars signal to constant 3-4 inside the house. Recommend this highly. Pricey but worth the money if you are tired of "can you hear me?", missed calls, voicemails with no call time or missed call and voicemails that show up 2-3 days later.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: No Service to Three Bars
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing this so I knew going in that to set it up correctly required patience and time. My husband and I had no trouble at all setting this up. For us it was pretty easy because we can see the closest cell tower from the top of the barn (a metal building on top of a hill). Our house burned down so we're living in an RV in the barn until we rebuild. Cell service ranged from none to one bar until we installed this. We now have consistently three bars.
customer_reviews.author: Goody

customer_reviews.title: When it worked, it worked....
customer_reviews.text: I liked it when it was working, I have 2 separate boosters, one is the same frequency bands and I ordered from China for cheaper than the we boost, I then ran them in parallel and offset the directional antenna's polarities 45 deg vertically off the mast. Not even a year old and it stopped working, i figured maybe the power supply, so found another 5v compatible power supply and no-go. Chinese booster still working wonderfully and is made with metal exterior, SMA on both ends, and have had almost 2 years now...I will NOT be buying another weBoost.
customer_reviews.author: CunningStunt

customer_reviews.title: Rural Maine... Solid 4 Bars!!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in rural Mid-Coast Maine & my 4G LTE Verizon signal on a Samsung Note 3 was at best 2-3 bars (-112dBm). Set up was easy, used OpenSignal.com & app ( to determine best cell tower location.... Now phone registers signal at -82dBm with a SOLID 4 BARS! VERY HAPPY as I use my phone as a hot spot for our home internet access & when on the road in our Motorhome (haven't quite figured out my mobile mounting, as yet, but did order the 12v power supply for the booster unit. The only difference between this Home 4-G model & the RV-4G model is that the RV comes with both power adapters (and costs more?). Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and customer support is great as well!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item 2 years ago and it worked great. I live in a rural area and the cell phone signal is weak. In the basement the signal was nonexistent. With the booster I was getting 3 to 4 bars and able to use the phone inside the house. Forward 2 years later, the booster stopped working and the lights just flashed green on the top. I contacted customer support and after running me through a couple of tests, they sent me a new power supply free of charge. Plugged it in and it fixed the problem. Great customer support and will definitely use them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piss Poor hardware design and/or poor QA
customer_reviews.text: 2 Grrrrs: I was so hyped after reading the reviews that I ordered the much needed weBoost.....It looked simple enough to hook up. Grrr #1: The hardware to mount the outside antenna had no matching holes in the outside antenna-and I wasn't about to drill holes right into the box (In case I had to return it-WHICH IA AM GOING TO DO). Grrr #2: The window (flat) coax had to female leads and thus was unable to screw onto the female lead on the booster. to try it out, I just laid the outside antenna on the roof and it did give me more bars on my phone but with the screw ups mentioned above, I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Seth-aaron Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Happy customers
customer_reviews.text: We spend summers in our trailer in a remote area. Before we installed this we were using only our phone hot spots for internet access on our smart tv. Movies were frustrating to watch due to the constant buffering. Since the weBoost, we have been able to watch movies with little buffering and been able to cancel our dish service. Even though the initial investment was quite a bit, we are now $$$ ahead and saving each month. Happy customers.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: works great and for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who lives in a rural area and in a low slight valley area. Her house gets no service for any provider and can't even get landline phone service by of her location. I installed it for her and immediately both of our phones worked, 4G and phone service! I have t-mobile and she has Sprint. I only mounted it on her exterior siding no pole or anything. I did mount it on the same side as her dish network cable so I'm assuming that's the best place to get reception.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: An affordable amplifier that is easy to set up.  Runs hot though!
customer_reviews.text: This booster is pretty decent. It allows me to amplify the Sprint signal getting to my Netgear Air Card. It gets very HOT while its on which worries me a bit. Maybe it could use better heat dissipation. Its simple and straightforward to use. Inside my house I have ZERO Sprint Signal and this gives me a steady 3 bars (out of 6). My other option was locating the Air Card outside the house and get 2 bars which was enough for my Netflix/Roku viewing and regular internet browsing. I wish the coaxial cables were 5 to 10 feet longer each (it comes with 2).
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Calero

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works. Improved my extremely weak signal in a remote area of NY. However, the range for inside antennae is not great. I still need to have my phone fairly close to the inside antennae. It captures my StraightTalk signal from 1 or 2 bars to full bars and my COMPLETELY non-existent T-mobile signal to 2 bars of 2G if I set the phone right in front of antennae. Definitely recommend for anyone in a remote and cell-isolated area.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Nunley

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a little bit confusing since the instructions were basically non-existent but the unit works as it said it would. My normally dead zone house gets about 2 bars, which is what I get outside. And it boosts my husbands phone which runs on a different bandwidth so he doesn't drop calls when in our hallway. We live about 20 miles from the closest antenna and our house is approximately 900 sq. ft., so this booster works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteSwan

customer_reviews.title: Life saving!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, I love this device. I put a new metal roof on my house. Before I did that I got maybe 2-3 bars of service out of 5. Once the new roof I got 0-1. I bought this and I now get 3-5 inside my house :) it’s not a huge range but I put it in my living room and it’s good in that room. The rest of the house sucks still but anything is better than 0. Lol
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: weboost
customer_reviews.text: Love it. We live in a rural area and also in a metal house, where we had no cell service or limited. Noe we can use our cell phones inside our house. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought. Now I love my Iphone
customer_reviews.text: It was a lot of money for me but I am completely happy. Have 3-4 bars now for phone used to get only 1 bar. And only had so so 3G now it's strong 4GLTE. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Jean Buskey

customer_reviews.title: We live in a cabin in the woods and receive 1 bar and 1x connection on a good day. We got the weBoost and it bumped ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing has definitely saved our lives! Haha. We live in a cabin in the woods and receive 1 bar and 1x connection on a good day. We got the weBoost and it bumped it up to 3 bars, but you have to be standing right in front of the booster or else your calls may drop or the connection will be really choppy. Most of our home has 1 bar, some of it has 2 bars, and like I mentioned, there are 3 bars right in front of the booster. It's a little bothersome having to hike upstairs to the bedroom every time I want to make a phone call, but hey! It beats driving out into town.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Get it if you need it.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far an investment that will not disappoint. I work in a Blast Resistant Module building in which only Verizon can penetrate (at 2 LTE bars). Other providers AT&T 1 bar LTE (maybe, mostly 3 bars 4G), Sprint same as AT&T, and T-mobile NO SERVICE. As you guessed it, after installation, all service providers went to full bars LTE. Installation was easy, just time consuming, due to routing of the wires from outdoors to inside (routes in/above the drop ceiling).
customer_reviews.author: Jdotrico

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WITH EXISTING RG6 COAXIAL CABLING IN THE HOME
customer_reviews.text: Used this product in a basement that otherwise had zero 4G signal. Connected to an existing coaxial cable wall jack for the exterior antenna, which was probably at least 100ft in length total. Works well... clear phone calls. Does not require a network connection, so it's very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that it only improves the signal in ONE ROOM
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. It does make the signal strong enough that I can be understood when talking on my cell phone....I am disappointed that it only improves the signal in ONE ROOM. Yes. One room only. Exactly where I put the apparatus - that room only. If I leave the room, I go back to NO SIGNAL. The room is not that big and the home is wood frame so I'm really baffled why the reception disappears immediately if I simply pass through a doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Improve the cellular signal
customer_reviews.text: We use to have 2bars of signal on the main level and no bars in the basement. After installing this booster we have 4bars and 2bars. My family is very happy about this booster. It will take some time to figure out the best direction and it is pretty clearly stated in the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Wenjun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cell Repeater! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product had amazing results. You do need to do your research. Visit the Wilson Electronics (or WeBoost, same company) website. Find your nearest tower with your cell provider, make sure that the outdoor antenna is pointed in the direction. Set this up and register it as per the directions, and it works really well. We used to get -125dB signal inside (one bar or less) and -110 dB outside (2 bars or less) with Verizon. After installing this device, we now get between -96 and -89 dB (3-4 bars). This device is amazing, highly recommended. This may even allow us to drop Frontier internet and use Verizon exclusively by hotspotting.
customer_reviews.author: Beastman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised  Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service,and technicians that know what their product can do or not do. Had little or no cell service inside our home. Now we can walk anywhere inside the house with no disconnects. Signal strength from the inside antenna was not initially very strong. Called customer service and they sent a slightly larger(more insulated) cable for the connection from the outside antenna into the house. The product is worth the price no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Dorfman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Doesn’t seem to increase 4G just voice slightly.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was fairly easy. Noticed a slight increase in voice reception but no increase in LTE. I owned the next version up of this one at my old house in Alaska and it seemed to work a lot better. If I leave my living room where this booster is I lose almost all service. Even <15 feet away in the kitchen the booster has no affect. My last hope is going to be installing the receiver antenna higher up on my roof in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: NSB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the weboost for 8 months now and it has worked exactly as advertised more than doubling my cell phone signal strength. However, the weboost recently stopped working and I contacted customer service about it. They asked questions to narrow down the possible problems and it was discovered the power adapter had gone bad with that customer service immediatly sent out a replacement which arrived today and my weboost is once again up and running. I will update if anything else comes up but for now highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: William Thomas

customer_reviews.title: ... a remote cabin in Alaska and have had very poor cell phone connections for years
customer_reviews.text: We live in a remote cabin in Alaska and have had very poor cell phone connections for years. We usually had to step outside to get any kind of cell signal. I was not sure if this would work because we are off grid using solar, batteries, and inverter. It was easy to set up and boosted our signal from 1 bar to a steady 3 bars. (Sometimes 4) Most important to remember is that you have to have a signal in your location. Very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. No monthly fee.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to put in our store. Had no service outside or inside. Now have a working phone inside. It says one bar but it works all the way including internet. Not sure what’s going to happen when it switches to 5g.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R

customer_reviews.title: Yup.
customer_reviews.text: Live out in the country in a concrete block house with metal roof. Get weak signal to begin with and impossible to get anything in the house. This boosts signal 20 to 30 DB. Good solid signal, stream videos. By the way, pry the back off outdoor antenna to access mounting holes. It neglects to mention that in the installation manual.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne D. Keller

customer_reviews.title: This Works!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this for my Father who had such bad reception in his home, we could not call him. Now with the signal booster installed, he does not need to walk outside to have a conversation. Perfect calls every time the kids call Dad. A note to everyone: you must follow the directions! 50 feet separation between the antenna and the receiver in the house. If you're not mechanically inclined, you will need to hire someone to install it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: SL of PA

customer_reviews.title: Too me from 1-2 bars to 5 bars in the basement next to my pool
customer_reviews.text: I had no signal at all in my basement due to my cement foundation and pool next to our guest bedroom. With setup taking 2 hours we now have 5 bars in the 1,500 sq ft. finished basement. I was shocked how well it worked. I have LTE and can stream netflix better than my wifi. Thanks! I was a little skeptical due to so many 1-star reviews with it not working. But not for me thankfully. I was very happy about the window adapter so I didn't have to drill through my walls. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: lte

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  Product fail
customer_reviews.text: This does work, however you have to be within 10 feet of the inside transmitter, may not work in the hole house of office. Good but not great value for the cost. UPDATE: After three years, it has quit working. One would think that $400.00 would buy more than 3 years of service; there are no moving parts to this, so why did it malfunction? Piece of k-rap.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A. Hurd Call

customer_reviews.title: Finding the best location took a little longer than I expected but ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I live in a rural area with cell tower 5 to 6 miles away (Sprint). Noticed improved reception with the unit. I also think it helps with my Hotspot device which I use for home internet. Finding the best location took a little longer than I expected but not unreasonable. I got four green lights as soon as I hooked it up.
customer_reviews.author: Fio

customer_reviews.title: it acted like it wasn't picking up an outside cell signal (we ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to setup. I tried three different setup scenarios for the location of unit and antenna. It wouldn't work, it acted like it wasn't picking up an outside cell signal (we don't have great signal outside, but we usually have one - three bars), and the manual said that the antenna was too close to the booster, but I had it further than recommended. It could have been a defected unit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I paid it does not boost the cell service very much you have to be within about 10 feet for it to really do any good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatly increased the coverage in my home
customer_reviews.text: I live a ways out of town and my cell coverage really sucks. Once I added this the coverage is much better. The tech support team was a great help when I originally installed it.
customer_reviews.author: David Howard

customer_reviews.title: Barely worked 3 months and the plug in the wall unit died.
customer_reviews.text: Will be contacting tech support next week after the 4th... may change review then. It worked from 4/1/20 till 7/2/20. today wall plug in unit is dead. Way too much money for a 3 month device.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: No signal to 3 to 4 bars
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought this one first. I bought a cheaper Chinese one that was junk. This one was easy to install and works like a charm. I really liked the flat RG6 connector so you cab close a door or window on it.
customer_reviews.author: kryptiea

customer_reviews.title: WeBoost really works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Before using weBoost we had to go outside to use cell phones due to lack of signal! After installing weBoost the signal has been amazing!! No more lost or dropped calls! This thing does what it says it’ll do!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Booster works as it should. Significantly improved my indoor reception. Please note that it takes your outside reception and brings it inside. So the quality of the inside reception depends on how good you direct the outside antenna.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Weboost Home 4 G Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Home 4 G for a seasonal RV site. We had -90 3 G and on LTE -119. So dropped calls and no data. After the Weboost install I got -63 on LTE I watched amazon video after I hotspoted my phone. Installation is easy but the unit does get hot. We are really happy to have reliable phone service and the kids can get shap chat again. My neighbor who had a different carrier and gets no service came over and got fast data in his phone, he will probably buy one next.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyDevil

customer_reviews.title: Phone no bars problems gone!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for us although the range inside our steel building is limited to about 30' away! it did improve all phones performance by at least 2 bars, would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: sonicguru

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Amplifier stop working after 1 year reached out to weBoost customer support and they blamed everything but their detective amplifier. I was very thorough in my emails about the failed amplifier and the steps I had taken to verify it was indeed bad. Yet they didn't want to send a replacement. They replied "it's unlikely your booster has failed".The 2 year warranty is no go if they will never honor it. Decided to go with Cel-Fi, for a REAL cell signal booster!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it advertises. I have a remote cabin that cell service is always "iffy". On a good day, 1-bar from the At&t cell tower would give us an opportunity to make calls and perhaps a text or two before fading. It was never consistent! We installed the WeBoost and now constantly get 3-Bars and on occasion 4 bars. Enough to stream-live on our computers and cell phones, and always able to make a call or send/receive a text. HIGHLY recommend the product for areas where cell-tower service is sketchy! Toby G Breon
customer_reviews.author: Terri L. Breon

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase for our Household
customer_reviews.text: YES. YES. YES. LOVE THIS SO MUCH. That being said, follow instructions. If you do not have good cell service outside of your home, I do not recommend this product. If you do and you are trying to bring it inside of your walls, this product is perfect for you. We went from 2 bars of 3G to full bars of LTE. This really helped our Verizon MiFi tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia

customer_reviews.title: Should of got one of these sooner.  Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted outside 20' on pole and works great. Bought used on Amazon for a discount and it only included quick setup guide for instructions. Went to Weboost.com and downloaded manual. Very informative and useful. Wilson has always made fine products and it looks like the quality continues under the WeBoost name. I live in rural Kansas and use LTE for my ISP. I had one bar with spotty service and this took me to 5 bars with 20M down and 12M up. It supports several users at once so when friends come over with other service providers they get LTE also.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Opinions

customer_reviews.title: It now works great even in bad weather
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in my camp in the mountains of NY. we had no signal at all. After we installed it we now have 2 to 4 bars in all of the rooms. The antenna is on a pole 20 feet over the roof. We had a little trouble with the location of the booster because of some feed back, but we worked it out by moving it around. It now works great even in bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Finally no dropped calls and LTE service
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, kept dropping calls and had spotty data connection because I live in a low area. Bought a cheaper booster and quit working, so I went with this and have had great luck with it. Always had to stand by the door to not drop call. But Live in older two story so it is about 30’ up but is receiving signal from tower that is straight line 9 miles. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: Improved from nearly no reception to pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This signal booster took a very weak, almost nonexistent signal and boosted it to where we get pretty good phone reception now and even usable internet most of the time. It must be installed properly. The included installation instructions are good and all of the equipment you need is included. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS AND FOLLOW THEM. Heed the warnings about keeping the components a particular distance apart and not pointing at each other. Once the equipment is installed, you need to experiment with antenna placement and direction to determine the best orientation for you. It may be that you get better reception when the antenna IS NOT pointed at a cell tower because signals bounce off roofs, buildings, mountains, etc..
customer_reviews.author: scott252

customer_reviews.title: It works... and so will you.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a difference... not a life-changing difference for 4G data, but good enough to keep the $70/month cable and dish companies away. Proper permanent installation is critical and not easy. Outside antenna had to go outside on a pipe so it could be aimed-- as much away from the inside antenna as toward a tower. Wison is a good company and Prime is a good way to buy w/o risk.
customer_reviews.author: ubercommuter

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing really works! I live in rural where we can only get Sat internet or LTE internetis, Sat internet is worthless, LTE works great at broadband speeds outside but spotty at best inside. Had -118 db inside my house, spotty conversations and data that bairly worked, out side seemed to work okay With -112 db. Climbed up on the roof one day and found -102 so I though I would give this a try. Wow! Once I hooked it up and my readings went to -80db inside my house! Phones work great and now my down load speeds have increased to over 25mbps consistantly. Highly recommend this to anyone that needs a boost!
customer_reviews.author: Brett H.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This signal booster is great! It does exactly what it claims to do. We have a metal roof which made the signal inside or house non- existent. We unpacked the box, found the best signal outside, hooked everything up and now we have a super strong 4G signal everywhere in the house. I was skeptical about spending this amount of money but I am so glad I did! It's worth every penny spent! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Hackney

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: Not all it is advertised to be. Everything makes it sound like it will make anyplace work. Crushing when Tech service says you did everything right, but when there is no signal to boost, there is nothing to boost and you still have no service...
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great Short Range Boostet
customer_reviews.text: I liked the support I received from tech support when the booster did not work as expected. Sent a few replacement parts and got it working. My only issue is it has a short range of signal improvement. It works best about 4 feet from the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: James Mills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This product surpassed my expectations. I live about ten miles out of town. My internet service was very slow-dial up speed at best. With this booster using my unlimited data plan on my cell phone I have super fast internet. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Brown

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This doesnt work. Such a waste of money and time. Tried to use it for my basement becus I lose service down their. Wasted an afternoon mounting the antenna and then running the cable. would return it but i dont want to get back up on the ladder and go thru all of it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mixed

customer_reviews.title: The signal is outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: Boost signal from Verizon tower in the mountains. We couldn't talk or get internet because our cabin is logs and a metal roof. We can text, talk,down load very quickly now. It is all contained inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie E Beatty

customer_reviews.title: 3 hours to install.
customer_reviews.text: I put the outside antenna at the peak of my roof under the eve of a 1 story house. I now have 4 green lights on unit. The tower is at least a mile away. I use cricket cell phones which uses AT&T towers. I bought the refurbished unit 1year warranty. The booster does get warm.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.  I’m sending it back
customer_reviews.text: I set it up per the instructions. With 4 green lights I could detect no improvement. I’ve tried several different occasions to use it. It’s a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sasquach

customer_reviews.title: It works for remote areas.
customer_reviews.text: I am out in the oilfield in Orla West Texas and before I installed this booster I basically had no usable service in my RV, on my Verizon phone. Since I installed the booster - with a 16' pole for the outside antenna - I have 4-5 bars and can both get internet as well as make calls. The difference is astounding. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Aussiecraig

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, after following all of the directions it doesn't work. No improvement what so ever. A waste of time AND money. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Campbell

customer_reviews.title: weBoost Cell booster
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. Love it . Get better cell service in the house than I do outside. We can now sit down when we talk on our phones and not just at the windows.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa P Durham

customer_reviews.title: weBoost Home 4G Cell Signal Booster
customer_reviews.text: I've tried numerous signal boosters over the years, I thought I would try one more time. Well, I got this unit in today (4/28/17) took the instructions did everything like the book said. Our signal isn't any better than it was before I install this kit. If I walk over to the inside antenna the signal will increase but when I turn and walk away it goes back to one bar. Not Good!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Riley

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my "Doro" 3G Flip Phone on the Consumer Cellular network.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my "Doro PhoneEasy 626" 3G Flip Phone on the Consumer Cellular network. I have a two story house and was getting a good signal on the upper floor but a poor to none signal on the lower floor. Now I get four or more bars on the lower floor.
customer_reviews.author: CTkec

customer_reviews.title: Cable (aux) connection gets extremely hot!
customer_reviews.text: The metal piece on the end of the cable that plugs into the unit gets extremely hot and I’m scared it could catch something on fire. I placed a thermometer on it just to see how hot it is and the thermometer got up to 110 degrees and then showed an error message... I suppose it was hotter than the thermometer could measure. I haven’t contacted the company about this yet but I intend to.
customer_reviews.author: Leslye R. Heard

customer_reviews.title: Not much improvement
customer_reviews.text: 300.00$ for a one bar improvement is not worth it in my opinion. I installed exactly per product specifications and yielded very small results. Save your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Short life span.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in February of 2017. It died on me last month.It worked good when I was in the same room and room next to it. I call product support to buy just the booster but they told me I would have to buy the whole set again. I'm not going to spend another $350 for something that only last 3 years. I bought a different brand. Hopefully this one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: We have a home with metal siding and literally could not receive or make calls without going outside. Our weBoost Home 4G made all the difference and we have no issues any longer at any part of our 3000 sf home.
customer_reviews.author: Smedley

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have a metal building workshop on my property that blocks all cell service inside. This device was super easy to install and now I am able to stream HD video where I previously had 0 bars of service.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Payne

customer_reviews.title: Worked at my camp in the wood's
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this signal amplifier for use in my cabin in a rural area in the upper peninsula of michigan. My phone normally showed no bars but messages would come through sporadically. I feared there was too little signal to successfully amplify. Surprisingly, it works quite well. If my phone is close to the interior transmitter, I can get 4 bars. It doesn't work if my phone isn't close (20' away), but I now am connected for emergency purposes and to keep connected.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this thing had so many neg review's. We went from no bars or one weak bar to 4 strong bars mount it out side and let it rip
customer_reviews.author: duckco

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This does work but the antenna could have been built better especially the holster for it, it plugs into an outlet so no batteries required and takes roughly 5 to 10 minutes to install from open to finish
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Does Ok
customer_reviews.text: JUST gets by but I can receive and make calls if I don't move. I wish I would had upsized because I live in a rural area with a weak signal to start with. BTW, the setup was easy to understand and it looks great installed on the side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it if have no service to start with
customer_reviews.text: Well for the money it was not worth it were we live.. it gave full bars but barely cld make a call.
customer_reviews.author: laurette mary mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: No bueno
customer_reviews.text: Zero improvement! All that is good is that my phone now shows me how BAD the reception is on the little bar on my phone. This moment -104 !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Brandvold

customer_reviews.title: Will work with good outside signal
customer_reviews.text: Bought unit from past experience with Wilson's products. I have T mobile service which is poor in a building anyway. My mobile has metal siding with no signal inside. With this unit the outside antenna in high enough that I get a 98 decibels inside. My phone outside only gets 108 db. Unit works well for me at this location as my tower us over 4 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Will D Hadlock

customer_reviews.title: Cellphone is finally usable in 2008 built condo
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the antenna in the attic as opposed to outside (because HOA prevents me from mounting outside, and window mounting showed worse signal). I also used existing pre-wired coax (meant for cable TV) to bring it to the 2nd floor of the 3 floor condo. I now have 2-4 bars of usable LTE signal throughout the house, as opposed to 0-2 bars that was unusable (because of energy efficient windows and insulation, my cell phone was only usable on the 3rd floor or outside before). In fact, my LTE signal coverage is more complete now than my 5GHz router + access point.
customer_reviews.author: Odi

customer_reviews.title: Replaced with higher unit
customer_reviews.text: First unit didn’t work, so I replaced it with a stronger one that did work. Pricey but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Malynda Adams

product_meta.title: weBoost Home 4G (470101) Indoor Cell Phone Signal Booster for Home and Office - Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint - Supports 1,500 Square Foot Area
product_meta.description: The weBoost Home 4G is our standard multi-user cell signal booster, designed to increase cellular connectivity and signal strength for one room or up to 1, 500 sq. ft. Users will experience faster data speeds, better voice quality, fewer dropped calls and superior streaming capability within its coverage area. The Home 4G is compatible with all phones and cellular-connected devices and works with all U. S. carriers; including Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, and more. Designed to improve communication lines at your home or office, this device enhances 4G LTE and 3G signals in buildings of up to 1, 500 square feet. The Home 4G from weBoost can power up your cell phone signal in 1 or 2 rooms of your home or workplace. It ensures better voice and data, fewer dropped calls, higher voice quality, and faster uploads and downloads. Equipped with a patented smart technology that senses signal conditions in and around the building, this innovative technology electronically optimizes the booster’s performance. The Home 4G works with all carriers in the United States: AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon, Sprint, Straight Talk, and U. S. Cellular. No matter what carrier you use, it is to increase the signal strength of any cellular device, giving you crystal clear calls and uninterrupted data. The package includes the Home 4G, an indoor antenna, an outdoor antenna, a power supply, and a 30-foot coaxial cable. You’ll experience easy and convenient installation of your booster when purchasing this complete pack! Our products come with 6-day support and a 2-year . Our highly trained technical staff will provide you with any assistance you need to get familiar with and use the device. We this booster will give you unmatched network reach, but if you still aren’t satisfied, we will be happy to fully refund you within 30 days of purchasing. Up to 2 hours additional talk time in weak-signal areasInvest in the weBoost Home 4G Cell Phone Signal Booster risk free and experience faster internet browsing and less dropped calls today. Power- 110-240V AC, 50-60 Hz, 20 W.
feature_bullets: STOP DROPPED CALLS: Boost 4G LTE and 3G cell phone signals in your home and office. Use for peace of mind while on important business calls and while speaking to loved ones. With a signal boosting range of up to 1500 sq. ft. this device extends your existing cellphone coverage in one to two rooms. The booster simply amplifies your existing signal to give you more bars and maintain fast data speeds while you browse the internet or talk on the phone.

WORKS WITH ALL U. S. CARRIERS: Verizon, AT&T, Sprint*, T-Mobile, Straight Talk, U.S. Cellular and many more. The Home 4G will work to improve your existing connection across multiple devices simultaneously. *Government regulations in the U.S. prohibit boosting a particular frequency used by some of the Sprint network. Most Sprint customers still see performance improvement from weBoost signal boosters.

FRUSTRATION FREE SET UP: The simple instructions and DIY installation make it easy to get your new booster set up and working quickly. All of the components you need for installation are included in the package with easy to read, step-by-step instructions. Some users report being able to set up the entire kit in as little as 10 minutes.

UP TO 32X STRONGER CONNECTION: Means fewer dropped calls, better voice quality, faster uploads and downloads. No more slow internet connections or long buffer times while watching your favorite streaming to shows and movies. Give your smartphone, tablet, data card, and notebooks boosted speeds all at the same time while using the Home 4G. Connectors: SMA-Female (inside antenna) | F-Female (outside antenna)

AUTOMATIC GAIN SETTINGS: The weBoost Home 4G booster uses patented smart technology to sense nearby signal conditions and electronically optimize the booster’s performance. The device provides a maximum signal gain of 60 decibels. This means that your booster will always optimize to provide you with the strongest signal and connection to keep your bars up and browsing speeds fast.
Compatible With all Major US Networks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,136 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
